place.name: BRACEBRIDGE
place.gazetteerText: BRACEBRIDGE, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; on the river Witham, 2 miles S of Lincoln r. station. Post Town, Lincoln. Acres, 1,482. Real property, £6,373. Pop., 836. Houses, 87. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £203.* Patron, Mrs. Bromhead. The county lunatic asylum is here; and a new chapel for it was built in 1869. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
